Summary: A small, solitary, stationary, static cloud vanished after 20 minutes of being observed bu me.
divs: sighting detailsi am a practicing architect, ex air force pilot(studied meteorology), and a member of mufon. on sunday, september 8, 2008, at 1000 hours, i began observing the mt.st.helens volcanocam, real-time-image on my windows xp pc, taken from the johnston ridge observatory, which is at 4500 foot elevation and about 5-miles nnw of the volcano. the volcanocam image updates every 60-seconds. i intended to meditate for 30-minutes by focusing on some minute aspect of the dormant volcano. rising from within the volcano, a whispy steam cloud ascended and crowned the right inside slope of the crater. at the same altitude as the right rim of the volcano, and about one-sixth of the diameter of the caldera distance out from the right rim was a small blimp-like, white, cumulous cloud the right end of which was spherical. the potato-with-onion shaped cloud appeared directly alongside the volcano. the movement of the misty cloud of steam suggested a left-to-right breeze, which also suggested that the small white cloud would drift steadily to the right. curious, i scribed a vertical line on the window glass, with a felt-tipped pencil, at the left end of the small white cloud. since the image updated every 60-seconds, i knew the movement of the white cloud would be easily seen. the white cloud measured only one-half inch in length on the computer glass. and i chose to focus on the left end of the cloud while meditating. i began focusing\meditating at 1008. minutes passed. the image updated every 60-seconds. but the white cloud was absolutely static. then i recalled reading in a ramtha book "ufo's and the nature of reality", ed. j.p. koteen, page 177: ufo's..."they appear as clouds. you will often see them when there is nothing else in the sky except one particular cloud." the small, unusually static, white cloud was the only cloud visible. at 1025 it vanished. a same diameter, white, also static, spherical cloud remained. (i printed a color copy of the volcano which just shows the left edge of the remaing cloud.)at 1039 it also vanished. at 1455 the same day,i returned to the volcanocam. a similar-to-earlier, small, white cloud hovered above the earlier spot. i made a color copy of the computer image which shows the left end, only, of the new cloud. don m. johnson p.s. a year ago while driving in ventura, i stopped at a traffic light. i was facing the ocean a little over a mile away. a brisk on-shore breeze swiftly bore a low-level-blanket of small cumulous clouds inland. but i noticed a small, but dense white cloud that hovered statically over the beach, while the other clouds raced around it. the scenario did not change as i drove toward the beach for several blocks and turned away. dmj
